sen.j: 現在でも大規模な合奏形態で演奏される伝統音楽としては世界最古の様式である。
sen.e: It has the world's oldest style as traditional music played in a large-scale ensemble form now.

sen.j: ただし、雅楽本来の合奏形態としては、応仁の乱以降、徳川幕府が楽師の末裔（楽家）をあつめて再編するまでは、100年以上断絶していたので、平安時代の形態をどこまで継承しているかは疑問である。
sen.e: However, the original ensemble form of Gagaku was discontinued for more than a hundred years until the Tokugawa Shogunate gathered the descendants of the musicians (Gaku families) and rebuilt it after the turmoil of the Onin war, and it is doubtful how precise the style in the Heian era is inherited.

sen.j: 篳篥のカタカナで記されている譜面を唱歌（しょうが メロディーを暗謡するために楽譜の文字に節をつけて歌う事）として歌うときにハ行の発音をファフィフフェフォと発音するなど16世紀以前の日本語の発音の特徴もそのまま伝えられており、全体的にもかなり忠実に再現されているのではないかということが推測される。
sen.e: The features of pronunciation of the Japanese language before the 16th century are passed on without change - the line of Ha is pronounced as fa, fi, fu, fe, fo, when singing the musical score of Hichiriki instrument written in katakana as Shoga (chanting the letters of the music note to recite the melody) for example, which implies that the whole style can be quite faithfully recreated.

The features of pronunciation of the Japanese language before the sixteenth century are passed on without change: the line of Ha is pronounced as fa, fi, fu, fe, fo, when singing the musical score of the Hichiriki instrumentation written in katakana as "Shoga," by chanting the letters of the music note to recite the melody for example, which implies that the whole style can be quite faithfully recreated.
